greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: the k-th column contains the k-fold iterated partial sum of A000566.
comment: The leftmost column contains the heptagonal numbers A000566.
The adjacent columns to the right are A002413, A002418, A027800, A051946, A050484.
reference: Analogous triangles for the hexagonal and pentagonal numbers are A125233 and A125232.
Albert H. Beiler, Recreations in the Theory of Numbers, Dover, 1966, p. 189.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: A000566 := proc(n) n*(5*n-3)/2 ; end: A125234 := proc(n,k) if k = 0 then A000566(n); elif k>= n then 0 ; else procname(n-1,k-1)+procname(n-1,k) ; fi; end: seq(seq(A125234(n,k),k=0..n-1),n=1..16) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 09 2009
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 24 2006
ext: Edited and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 09 2009
